Are you saying that a restart didn't fix the problem? Also, can you offer any insight into how you got into this state. It would also be helpful if you describe the exact steps you took to synchronize (i.e. was it from the Synchronize view or using Team>Synchronize from another view) and what perspective you were in.

It appears that the error is coming from a Tree that contains an image that is disposed. However, from the trace it is not clear to me what tree is causing the problem since the error is happening when the wizard dialog that contains the synchronize wizard is running the event loop.

TOd, can you offer any insight here?
It occurred inside the synchronize view when I synchronized selecting both items in the synchronize dialog.

I got it again using:

Steps to reproduce:
1) Start a workspace synchronization
2) Once it is started, go to the CVS repository view and try to check out another project that is not in your workspace.
3) You should get the exception in the error log view.
I know I saw it at Olivier's desk but I am not able to reproduce this with 3.3.
